The Sun Worshippers/Yellowleg

written bySid Fleischman

1/1/2012

Stark House is proud to announce the first printing of Sid Fleischman's unpublished novel from the 1960's, The Sun Worshippers. Set in a Southern California desert community, it tells a story of love and deceit as a world-weary writer tries to peel back the layers of lies surrounding the town's founder. Yellowleg, on the other hand, is a western tale of revenge, which Sam Peckinpah turned into his first film, The Deadly Companions. Fleischman's son, Paul, contributes an introduction.

The Whipping Boy

written bySid FleischmanandJuvenile Collection (Library of Congress)

Published by Greenwillow Books - 4/14/1986

A bratty prince and his whipping boy have many adventures when they inadvertently trade places after becoming involved with dangerous outlaws.

The White Elephant

written bySid Fleischman

Published by Greenwillow Books - 10/17/2006

In old Siam, young elephant trainer Run-Run and his old charge, Walking Mountain, must deal with the curse of a sacred white elephant.

The Midnight Horse

written bySid Fleischman

Published by Greenwillow - 9/24/1990

Touch enlists the help of The Great Chaffalo, a ghostly magician, to thwart his great-uncle's plans to put Touch into the orphan house and swindle The Red Raven Inn away from Miss Sally.

Did you know that the movie The Deadly Companions is based on the book The Deadly Companions?

The Civil War Yankee sergeant Yellowleg saves the cheater Turkey from hanging after a card game, and together with Turk's gunslinger buddy Billy Keplinger, they ride together to Gila City with the intention of heisting a bank. When other bandits rob a store, Yellowleg shoots at the outlaws and accidentally kills the son of the cabaret dancer Kit Tilden and the grieving woman decides to bury her son in the town of Siringo in Apache country where her husband is buried. Yellowleg Enlists Billy and Turkey to escort Kitty and the coffin through the dangerous land.
